page.title: 14MOBBERLEY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of St. Wilfred stands on raised ground in the centre of the parish and dates from 1245. The tower was rebuilt in 1533 and contains a peal of six bells. The intricately carved rood screen dates from c.1500. The church is built of stone and slate roof. The interior ceiling is heavily timbered and patterned. The oldest gravestone is dated 1570 and burials still take place today: some in family graves. Douglas Gittins keeps the graveyard mowed and tidy. Services are held each Sunday at 8.00am,10.30am and 6.30pm There is communion on the first and last Sunday in each month. Recent rectors include Canon Randall who served from 1946 to 1980 with much distinction. The present rector is Rev F.D. Moss.
